meanings.definition: The action of replacing something old or outdated with something new.
meanings.sent1: The supersession of the old computer system with a more advanced one was necessary for efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The supersession of the traditional methods with modern technology has greatly improved productivity.
meanings.sent3: The supersession of the worn-out shoes with brand new ones made the person feel like they were walking on clouds.
meanings.sent4: The supersession of the old ways with innovative ideas sparked a wave of creativity in the team.
meanings.sent5: The supersession of the outdated software with the latest version was like upgrading from a bicycle to a sports car.

meanings.definition: The act of taking the place of something or someone else.
meanings.sent1: Her supersession as the team captain brought new energy and leadership to the group.
meanings.sent2: The supersession of the retiring CEO by a younger successor marked a new era for the company.
meanings.sent3: The cat's supersession of the dog's favorite spot by the sunny window led to a hilarious standoff.
meanings.sent4: The rising star's supersession of the veteran actor in the lead role surprised everyone with her talent.
meanings.sent5: The supersession of the old mascot by a new, more popular one brought fresh excitement to the fans.
